section_purpose: This section introduces the foundational concepts of propositional logic, Boolean formulas in Conjunctive Normal Form (CNF), and formally defines the SAT and #SAT problems, which are the core computational tasks addressed by the paper.
key_points: A Boolean formula is composed of Boolean variables and logical operators like negation, conjunction, and disjunction.
Boolean formulas are commonly represented in Conjunctive Normal Form (CNF), which is a conjunction of clauses, where each clause is a disjunction of literals.
The SAT (Satisfiability Problem) asks whether a variable assignment exists that satisfies a given CNF formula.
The #SAT (Propositional Model Counting Problem) aims to count the total number of satisfying assignments (models) for a CNF formula.
